channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Astronomers create first detailed map of sun's coronal magnetic fields

item.title: One of world's fastest ocean currents is remarkably stable, study finds
item.description: Scientists found that the strength of the Florida Current, the beginning of the Gulf Stream system and a key component of the global Atlantic Meridion...

item.title: Ideas Labs to advance research capacity at the nation's historically Black colleges and universities
item.description: The U.S. National Science Foundation has awarded $10.5 million for Ideas Lab projects to assess and address research capacity needs, increase access t...

item.title: Light pollution a new Alzheimer's risk factor
item.description: Outdoor light at night could be a significant risk factor in Alzheimer's disease, according to new research from Rush.

item.title: New study reveals evidence of ice-free times at the center of the Greenland Ice Sheet
item.description: A new paper published in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences shows direct evidence of Greenland being ice-free within the last 1.1 mil...

item.title: Microscale robot folds into 3D shapes and crawls

item.title: Genes with strong impact on menopause timing also link to cancer risk
item.description: The team first looked at variation in data from genetic sequencing of 106,973 post-menopausal female participants in the UK Biobank study. Researchers...

item.title: Lakes in marginalized communities sampled less, study finds
item.description: Water is essential for all forms of life — humans included — and understanding the quality of available water is critical to knowing where to drink, s...

item.title: Discovery of a new phase of matter in 2D which defies normal statistical mechanics
item.description: Physicists have created the first two-dimensional version of the Bose glass, a novel phase of matter that challenges statistical mechanics.
